qas.question: Who were the first men to make large contributions to international law?
What international law was Henry Dunant mostly responsible for?

context: Also, other human rights were advocated for by some Protestants. For example, torture was abolished in Prussia in <a0_0>1740<a0_0/>, slavery in Britain in <a1_0>1834<a1_0/> and in the United States in 1865 (William Wilberforce, Harriet Beecher Stowe, Abraham Lincoln - against Southern Protestants). <a2_0>Hugo Grotius and Samuel Pufendorf<a2_0/> were among the first thinkers who made significant contributions to international law. <a4_0>The Geneva Convention<a4_0/>, an important part of humanitarian international law, was largely the work of <a3_0>Henry Dunant<a3_0/>, a reformed pietist. He also founded the Red Cross.
